arm_group.description: A single fecal microbiota transplantation via colonoscope as an adjunct therapy to standard medical treatment

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to find out whether a single fecal microbiota transplantation
      is an effective and safe treatment as an adjunct to standard therapy in children with
      ulcerative colitis.

clinical_study.brief_title: Fecal Microbiota Transplantation in Children With Ulcerative Colitis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  active ulcerative colitis (PUCAI 10-64) in children in whom fecal microbiota
             transplantation via colonoscope can be performed

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  severe ulcerative colitis (PUCAI > 65)

clinical_study.official_title: Single Fecal Microbiota Transplantation Via Colonoscope as an Adjunct Therapy in the Treatment of Pediatric Ulcerative Colitis

other_outcome.measure: Number of participants with adverse events

primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the Pediatric Ulcerative Colitis Activity Index (PUCAI) at 1 month Change from baseline in the PUCAI at 3 months Change from baseline in the PUCAI at 6 months Change from baseline in the PUCAI at 12 months
